contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time <gallery> File:Saakashvili76589.jpg|Mikheil Saakashvili File:Charles the Bold 1460.jpg|Charles the Bold File:Nellie Tayloe Ross.jpg|Nellie Tayloe Ross </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- | [[1463]] – French poet '''[[François Villon]]''' was banned from [[Paris]] by the [[Parlement]] after being [[Commutation of sentence|commuted]] from a [[Capital punishment|death sentence]]. | needs more footnotes |- | [[1477]] – [[Burgundian Wars]]: '''[[Charles the Bold]]''', the [[Duke of Burgundy]], was killed at the [[Battle of Nancy]], eventually leading to the partition of [[Burgundy (region)|Burgundy]] between France and the [[Habsburg_Netherlands|House of Habsburg]]. | needs more footnotes |- | [[1527]] – '''[[Felix Manz]]''', co-founder of the original [[Swiss Brethren]] [[Anabaptist]] congregation in [[Zürich]], was executed by drowning, becoming one of the first martyrs of the ''[[Radical Reformation]]''. | no footnotes, lead too short |- | [[1895]] – '''[[Alfred Dreyfus]]''', a Jewish officer in the [[military of France|French military]] wrongly accused of [[treason]], was stripped of his rank and sentenced to [[life imprisonment]] on [[Devil's Island]]. | appears on [[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/October 15|October 15]] |- | [[1933]] – Construction began on the '''[[Golden Gate Bridge]]''' across the [[Golden Gate|Straits of the Golden Gate]], the entrance to [[San Francisco Bay]]. | appears on [[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/May 27|May 27]] |- | [[1971]] – The first '''[[One Day International]]''' [[cricket]] match was held between [[Australia national cricket team|Australia]] and [[England national cricket team|England]] at the [[Melbourne Cricket Ground]]. | refimprove |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[1941]] – [[World War II|Second World War]]: Australian and British troops '''[[Battle of Bardia|defeated]]''' Italian forces in [[Bardia]], Libya, the first battle of the war in which an [[Australian Army]] formation took part. {{*mp}} [[1976]] – [[The Troubles]]: In response to the '''[[Reavey and O'Dowd killings|killings of six Catholics]]''' the night before, the [[South Armagh Republican Action Force]] '''[[Kingsmill massacre|killed ten Protestants]]''' in [[County Armagh]], Northern Ireland. {{*mp}} [[1991]] – [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]]n troops attacked [[Tskhinvali]], the capital of [[South Ossetia]], opening the '''[[1991–1992 South Ossetia War]]'''. {{*mp}} [[1996]] – [[Hamas]] operative '''[[Yahya Ayyash]]''' was assassinated by a bomb-laden cell phone, planted by Israel's [[Shin Bet]]. {{*mp}} [[2005]] – '''[[Eris (dwarf planet)|Eris]]''', the largest known [[dwarf planet]] in the [[Solar System]], was discovered by a team led by [[Michael E. Brown]] using images originally taken on {{Nowrap|October 21}}, 2003, at the [[Palomar Observatory]] in [[San Diego County, California]]. {{*mp}} [[2008]] – [[Mikheil Saakashvili]]<!--not bold, refimprove--> was '''[[Georgian presidential election, 2008|decisively re-elected]]''' as [[President of Georgia]] in "the first genuinely competitive presidential election" in the history of the country. {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[January 5]]''': '''[[Twelfth Night (holiday)|Twelfth Night]]''' (Western Christianity) <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em"> [[File:Bridge into Hobart.jpg|Tasman Bridge|100x100px]] </div> {{*mp}} [[1757]] – [[Louis XV of France]] survived an assassination attempt by '''[[Robert-François Damiens]]''', who later became the last person to be executed in the country by [[Hanged, drawn and quartered|drawing and quartering]]. {{*mp}} [[1925]] – '''[[Nellie Tayloe Ross]]''' was inaugurated as [[List of Governors of Wyoming|Governor of Wyoming]], the first [[List of female state governors in the United States|woman to serve as governor]] of a [[U.S. state]]. {{*mp}} [[1968]] – [[Alexander Dubček]] came to power in [[Czechoslovakia]], beginning a period of political liberalization known as the '''[[Prague Spring]]''' that ended with a [[Warsaw Pact invasion of Czechoslovakia|military intervention]] by the [[Warsaw Pact]] nations to halt reform. {{*mp}} [[1975]] – The [[Tasman Bridge]] ''(pictured)'', crossing the [[Derwent River (Tasmania)|Derwent River]] in [[Hobart]], [[Tasmania]], Australia, '''[[Tasman Bridge disaster|was struck]]''' by the bulk carrier ''[[MV Lake Illawarra|Lake Illawarra]]'', killing seven of the ship's crewmen and five motorists on the bridge. {{*mp}} [[2003]] – [[Metropolitan Police Service|London police]] arrested six people in conjunction with an alleged '''[[Wood Green ricin plot|terrorist plot]]''' to release [[ricin]] on the [[London Underground]], although only one was eventually convicted. </ul> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=January|Day=5}} <noinclude> </noinclude>
